issues.description: The problem statement and solution specify a method named emptyStock(), but the template Stock class provides clearInventory() instead and lacks emptyStock(). This name mismatch prevents students from implementing the required method and leads to confusion when following the specification.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the clearInventory() method in the template to emptyStock(), matching the problem specification and solution; or add an emptyStock() method that calls clearInventory() and deprecate clearInventory().

issues.description: The Stock class method for emptying the stock is named 'clearInventory' in the template, whereas the problem statement and solution use 'emptyStock'. This inconsistency can confuse students when mapping the UML requirement to the provided code.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the template method 'clearInventory' to 'emptyStock' so that it matches the UML in the problem statement and the implementation in the solution.
